column2: original
column5: Used constraint

column2: A claim should be created before it can be approved or rejected.
column3: Student un-involved in our approach generated and searched for various syntactic descriptions of the same constraint. Applies to constraints 1 to 19
column5: A claim should be created, before it can be approved.
A claim must be created, before it is approved.
When a claim is created, it may be approved.
If a claim is created, it can be approved.
They have to create the claim, before they can approve it.
Only after a claim is created, it is possible to approve the claim.
If a claim is approved, then it must have been created first.
To approve a claim, it should be created first.
A claim can be approved, after it has been created.
Approving the claim can happen at anytime, unless it still needs to be created.
Creation of the claim is required, before it can be approved.
The creation of the claim is a condition for the approval of the claim.
Only after the creation of a claim, the approval of the claim is possible.
When approval of the claim occurs, creation of the claim must have preceded.
If approval of the claim occurs, then creation of the claim must have been carried out first.
The approval of the claim requires that the creation of the claim occurs before it.
The approval of the claim should be preceded by the creation of the claim.
A claim must be created, before it can be approved or rejected.

column2: A claim should be approved before it can be paid out.
column5: A claim should be approved before it can be paid out.

column2: Once a claim has been approved, it should eventually be paid out.
column5: Once a claim has been approved, it should eventually be paid out.

column2: Once a claim has been rejected, it should not be paid out.
column5: Once a claim has been rejected, it should not be paid out.

column2: Payout should end the process and therefor exclude everything.
column3: n/a (aside from spelling mistake in therefor)
column5: Payout should end the process and therefore exclude everything.

column2: Case closed manually, can happen at any time, unless we still need to pay out the claim.
column3: changed synthetic labels to proper sentence
column5: A case can be closed manually at any time, unless we still need to pay out the claim.

column2: The case can be managed at the union, LO and DA after it has been created.
column3: Omitted unspecified actor abbreviations DA and LO to allow parser to improve parser accuracy
column5: The case can be managed at the union after it has been created.

column2: After a case is created, LO can and must arrange a meeting between the union case worker, the LO case worker and the DA case worker.
column3: Omitted unspecified actor abbreviations DA and LO to allow parser to improve parser accuracy
column5: After a case is created, management can and must arrange a meeting between the union case worker and the other case worker.

column2: After a meeting is arranged it must be held (organized by LO).
column3: Removed additional information within brackets to clean up constraint
column5: After a meeting is arranged it must be held.

column2: To create a case, the case worker should enter metadata on the case, inform about when he/she is available for participating in a meeting and then submit the case.
column5: The case worker should enter metadata on the case, inform about when he is available for participating in a meeting and then submit the case.

column2: When a case is submitted it may get a local id at the union, but it should also subsequently be assigned a case id in LO.
column5: When a case is submitted it may get a local id at the union, but it should also subsequently be assigned a case id in LO.

column2: When a case is submitted, LO should eventually propose dates.
column5: When a case is submitted, LO should eventually propose dates.

column2: Only after LO has assigned its case id it is possible to manage the case and for LO to propose dates.
column5: Only after LO has assigned its case id it is possible to manage the case and for LO to propose dates.

column2: Once a date has been agreed upon a meeting should eventually be held.
column5: Once a date has been agreed upon a meeting should eventually be held.

column2: Every process instance starts by examining a patient.
column5: Every process instance starts by examining a patient.

column2: If an x-ray is taken, then the x-ray risk must be checked before it
column3: cut second part since we do not currently consider alternate constraints
column5: If an x-ray is taken, then the x-ray risk must be checked before it

column2: Perform reposition, Apply cast and Perform surgery require that Perform X-ray occurs before they are executed.
column3: changed synthetic labels to proper sentence
column5: Performing a reposition, applying a cast and performing surgery require that x-rays are performed before.

column2: If a surgery is performed, then prescription of rehabilitation occurs eventually after it.
column5: If a surgery is performed, then prescription of rehabilitation occurs eventually after it.

column2: After a cast is applied, eventually the cast is removed and vice versa, before every removal of a cast, a cast must be applied.
column5: After a cast is applied, eventually the cast is removed and vice versa, before every removal of a cast, a cast must be applied.

column2: The process begins with the booking of the ticket
column5: The process begins with the booking of the ticket

column2: Personal information of passengers can be provided after the booking of the ticket
column5: Personal information of passengers can be provided after the booking of the ticket

column2: The payment of the ticket triggers the completion of the booking phase.
column5: The payment of the ticket triggers the completion of the booking phase.

column2: The payment of the ticket is eventually followed by the actual transfer of money
column5: The payment of the ticket is eventually followed by the actual transfer of money

column2: As long as the Check-in of the flight does not take place, the customers can still modify the provided data to change
column5: As long as the Check-in of the flight does not take place, the customers can still modify the provided data to change

column2: After check-in of the flight, only the cancellation is admitted
column5: After check-in of the flight, only the cancellation is admitted

column2: The process starts when an invoice is received by the administration department.
column5: The process starts when an invoice is received by the administration department.

column2: If they decide that the invoice appears legit then they enter all relevant data into the system, in particular the amount the invoice is for, which is used by the workflow system to determine whose approval is needed for the invoice.
column5: If they decide that the invoice appears legit then they enter all relevant data into the system

column2: When all necessary approvals have been received the invoice can be paid.
column5: When all necessary approvals have been received the invoice can be paid.

column2: Once payment is confirmed, the invoice case should be closed.
column5: Once payment is confirmed, the invoice case should be closed.

column2: Receive invoice is required before the administration department can execute Enter data or Scan invoice.
column3: changed synthetic labels to proper sentence
column5: The receipt of an invoice is required before the administration department can enter data or scan the invoice.

column2: Enter data is required before any approval can be given.
column5: Enter data is required before any approval can be given.

column2: Finally, we have to pay the invoice before we can confirm payment.
column5: Finally, we have to pay the invoice before we can confirm payment.

column2: If a request is sent, then a proposal is expected to be prepared afterwards
column5: If a request is sent, then a proposal is expected to be prepared afterwards

column2: A confirmation is supposed to be mandatorily given after the proposal, and vice-versa any proposal is expected to precede a confirmation
column5: A confirmation is supposed to be mandatorily given after the proposal, and vice-versa any proposal is expected to precede a confirmation

column2: Every process instance has to start with activity "register client data"
column3: changed synthetic labels to proper sentence
column5: Every process instance has to start by registering client data

column2: Every –room service” must be billed.
column3: changed synthetic labels to proper sentence
column5: Every provided room service must be billed.

column2: Every –laundry service” must be billed.
column3: changed synthetic labels to proper sentence
column5: Every provided laundry service must be billed

column2: When the client –checks-out” the bill must be "charged"
column3: changed synthetic labels to proper sentence
column5: When the client leaves, the bill must be charged
